intro: Phyteuma orbiculare subvar. confusum, commonly known as the confused orbicular phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or grassy habitats. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
